intro: Neomammillaria dawsonii, commonly known as the Dawson's milk barrel cactus, is a species native to the Sonoran Desert of North America. It is a small, globular cactus with a ribbed structure and a pale green or blue-gray color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are typically short-lived but highly attractive to pollinators. It has a slow growth rate and is well adapted to arid conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy stem. Neomammillaria dawsonii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its compact size and unique appearance.
